Package game.action

Class NearMe

java.lang.Object
game.action.NearMe
public class NearMe
extends java.lang.Object
A utilities class to get the surroundings of an actor

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    NearMe()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static java.util.List<Actor> getSurroundingActors​(Actor actor, GameMap map, int radius)
    Given an actor, find all the actors near it Approach description: 1) gets the surrounding locations 2) iterate through the surrounding locations 3) check if an Actor exist at that location 4) if an actor exist, add the actor the list Note: cannot be used to get direction which is used for UI purposes
    static java.util.ArrayList<SurroundingExit> getSurroundingExitTargets​(Actor whoHasThis, Location currentLocation)
    Approach description: 1) loop through all exits 2) if the exit contains an actor, 2.1) get the actor 2.2) check if the person who called this and the target have different types 2.2.1) create a SurroundingExit and store it to the list Note: why need a new object called SurroundingExit? cause, the whole reason of using exit rather than the above functions is to know the direction
    static java.util.List<Location> getSurroundingLocations​(Actor actor, GameMap map, int radius)
    given an actor, find all the locations around it Approach description: 1) get the current Location of the actor calling this method 2) get the boundaries of the map 3) loop through all possible coordinates within the boundary 4) add it to the list Assumptions: resulting list can only used to check surrounding, cannot move to that location cause no checking is done to ensure that area is accessible
    static java.util.ArrayList<Location> isSpecificActorTypeInMyRange​(Actor actor, GameMap map, int radius, ActorTypes type)
    Gets a list of actors which have the wanted type around the actor that called this function Approach description: 1) loop through all the surrounding locations 2) check if there is an actor there 2.2) Get the actor 2.3) add to list

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • NearMe

      public NearMe()

  • Method Details

    • getSurroundingActors

      public static java.util.List<Actor> getSurroundingActors​(Actor actor, GameMap map, int radius)
      Given an actor, find all the actors near it Approach description: 1) gets the surrounding locations 2) iterate through the surrounding locations 3) check if an Actor exist at that location 4) if an actor exist, add the actor the list Note: cannot be used to get direction which is used for UI purposes
      Parameters:
      actor - the Actor we want the surrounding of
      map - the map
      radius - the radius of the surrounding
      Returns:
      the list of actors around the actor list is empty if no actors are around

    • getSurroundingLocations

      public static java.util.List<Location> getSurroundingLocations​(Actor actor, GameMap map, int radius)
      given an actor, find all the locations around it Approach description: 1) get the current Location of the actor calling this method 2) get the boundaries of the map 3) loop through all possible coordinates within the boundary 4) add it to the list Assumptions: resulting list can only used to check surrounding, cannot move to that location cause no checking is done to ensure that area is accessible
      Parameters:
      actor - the Actor we want the surrounding of
      map - the map
      radius - the radius of the surrounding
      Returns:
      a list of locations around the actor

    • getSurroundingExitTargets

      public static java.util.ArrayList<SurroundingExit> getSurroundingExitTargets​(Actor whoHasThis, Location currentLocation)
      Approach description: 1) loop through all exits 2) if the exit contains an actor, 2.1) get the actor 2.2) check if the person who called this and the target have different types 2.2.1) create a SurroundingExit and store it to the list Note: why need a new object called SurroundingExit? cause, the whole reason of using exit rather than the above functions is to know the direction
      Parameters:
      whoHasThis - the attacker
      currentLocation - the current location of the attacker
      Returns:
      a list of a new object which holds information regarding the target and exit list is empty if there is no actor around
      See Also:
      SurroundingExit

    • isSpecificActorTypeInMyRange

      public static java.util.ArrayList<Location> isSpecificActorTypeInMyRange​(Actor actor, GameMap map, int radius, ActorTypes type)
      Gets a list of actors which have the wanted type around the actor that called this function Approach description: 1) loop through all the surrounding locations 2) check if there is an actor there 2.2) Get the actor 2.3) add to list
      Parameters:
      actor - the actor executing the action
      map - the map itself
      radius - the radius of the search
      Returns:
      list of location if the actor is present within range empty list if not within range
